text: The Spacecraft Atmosphere Monitor The Spacecraft Atmosphere Monitor is a machine that is being tested on the International Space Station to check on the health of the astronauts on it. It ensures that the air quality in the spacecraft is free of gas contaminants. It is planned on being used during the Artemis program in the Orion spacecraft. It was first tested on July 29, 2019. == See also == *Human spaceflight == References == Category:International Space Station Category:Artemis program Category:Spacecraft instruments
title: Spacecraft Atmosphere Monitor
